PageTitle: display bgp vpn-target routing-table peer advertised-routes
FuncDef: The display bgp vpn-target routing-table peer advertised-routes command displays information about routes in the BGP-VPN-Target address family. The display bgp vpn-target routing-table peer advertised-routes command displays information about routes in the BGP-VPN-Target address family.
CLIs: display bgp vpn-target routing-table peer { <ipv4-address> | <ipv6-address> } advertised-routes
display bgp vpn-target routing-table peer <ipv4-address> advertised-routes

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv4 address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies an IPv6 peer address.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal string in format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Displays information about routes advertised to a specified peer.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> display bgp vpn-target routing-table peer 1.1.1.1 advertised-routes
Status codes: * - valid, > - best, d - damped, x - best external, a - add path,
